section.title: Overview
section.para: The Eclipse SCADA system will install a number of applications and libraries. There it is recommended to use some package manager to install the whole system.

The problem with the Windows platform is, that the MSI system does not provide an easy way to have package dependencies or automatic dependency resolution. Therefore the situation on Windows platforms is different. The configuration tool will create "ready-to-run" MSI packages, which contain the software and the configuration.

section.title: Pre-Requisites
section.para:
Installing the Eclipse SCADA systems requires:
Administrative permissions (aka "root access")
Java 7 (JRE)

In addition to the basic software packages that you can install using Eclipse SCADA is not much fun without having a configuration for your system. So in addition to the basic software you will need some sort of configuration to deploy. The easiest way to create you own configuration is by using the configuration tool described under .

section.title: Which platform to use?
section.para:
The question about the best platform will never be really answered. However there are two facts to consider:
Eclipse SCADA is tested mostly on the most recent Ubuntu LTS release, 64bit
Client applications are most often used on Windows 7+ installations (32 or 64bit)
The decision which platform to use is finally yours!
